message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC. 

The paper deals with detecting and recognizing human activities using RGBD sensors, which involves computer vision and robotics. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) and cs.RO (Robotics) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also uses a hierarchical maximum entropy Markov model, which involves machine learning and probabilistic modeling, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. Finally, the paper mentions personal assistive robotics, indicating a potential application in human-computer interaction, which falls under cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction).
